ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: ok
Elaine Hooper
Elaine Hooper
Elaine Hooper

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: 2) I think the most needed change in the professor's delivery is to provide a critical piece of feedback once in a succinct sentence. Often times the feedback was stated several times over repeatedly, which reduced the power of the initial feedback and often times made people more embarassed than necessary.5) The calzones and salad were a fun change!7c) Elaine was a standout TA. She provided extremely valuable feedback--both orally and written. She and Mark proved to be an extremely adept team in providing well-rounded, thoughtful advice. Her willingness to provide one-on-one help with statistical analysis is absolutely invaluable.10) I think this course should be more highly encouraged for all students pursuing the MFS and MESC degrees. It should be considered a second year segue from Research Methods and some efforts should be made to make sure that the first two weeks of this class aren't too much of a review for those who have taken Research Methods.
It provides a timeline, guidance, and opportunity to advance MESc research.
Gives student the opportunity to think through their research projects

The fact that it's keeping my research work on schedule. In many ways this class provides the guidance I anticipated receiving from my advisor.The written feedback from my peers on my last draft in addition to Mark and Elaine's commentary.Seeing my peers grow and improve over the semester. It was very inspiring and exciting!Again, I can't emphasize enough how important this class has been in keeping my research work on track.

1. Mark Ashton is remarkable in his ability to provide insightful feedback to students studying in such an incredibly broad range of academic fields.2. Dr. Ashton will tear you apart during your first presentation to your peers, but you will finish the course a much, much improved presenter. (You present 5+ times during the course.)3. Given all the presentations, you get a lot of peer feedback. It will sharpen your research and communication skills.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Change the title and let students know that this class exists!

Keeping presenters to the allotted time--both for their learning and for the sake of those wholisten to the presentations.More notice should be given about preliminary results being expected in the last draft.It would be tremendous if students were given the option to being working with Elaine on their data analysis at the beginning of the semester. Even though it wouldn't be discussed in class until the end of the semester I would have appreciated the opportunity to work on it all along.The name of the course should be changed! Even my advisor didn't know what the class was about and based on the course title advised me against taking it.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Very helpful and responsive.
See further description about 7c for information about the TA.Mark made himself available when help was requested and was very generous with his time and liberal with advice.
Elaine Hooper is, in the words of Dr. Ashton, a rock star. She is incredibly sweet, accomplished, and academically amazing--go to her with questions!

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: It is the only class offered to guide students working on their research. The name needs to be changed because it is not a class on advanced silviculture. It is a research class.

This course is critical to my final degree requirement and is helping me address the most difficult components of the degree in a supportive and structured environment.I think that all MFS and MESC students should be strongly encouraged to take this course. This would be aided by a change of the course name to something that more closely matches what the course actually tackles.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I heard from a peer about 2 weeks into the semester. She asked why I wasn't in the class. I said because it is called advanced silviculture. I did't know that this kind of class was offered. I feel that there should be a class that bridges both qualitative and quantitative research.
To improve on my ability to evaluate scientific researches and work in Silviculture.
My advisor is on sabbatical this semester and this course provided the structure I needed in his absence. It was also highly recommended by students who took the course last year.
To keep me on top of my research.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
Yes it did!
It did.
Yes

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Yes i did.
I'm very happy to have a rough draft of my research article halfway done at this point in time. This would not have been the case without this class.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I didn't participate in a work group.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it if you want to keep moving with your research. Don't be put off by the inappropriate title.

Be proactive--continue to work on your research during the slower periods in the course. If it isn't widely offered approach Elaine about getting started on your data analysis right away in September.Provide good advice to your peers. It's just as valuable as the feedback you receive from Mark and Elaine!Be prepared to be patient with your peers and with the class on the whole, because they will be patient with you.
It is essentially a more structured independent studies course where you benefit from a ton of professor, peer, and TA feedback. That should be your expectation for the course.
